newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Manulife to take full control of Manulife Regent.
newsitem.headline: Manulife to take full control of Manulife Regent.

text.p: Canadian life insurer Manulife Financial will take full control of its 50-percent-held mutual fund firm Manulife Regent Investment Corp by acquiring the other half from Hong Kong investment house Regent Pacific Group, the shareholders said in a joint statement on Monday.
Manulife Regent was expected to change its name to Manulife Funds Direct after the deal, scheduled to be completed on December 17, the statement said.
The takeover would cover Manulife Regent's Hong Kong subsidiary Manulife Regent Investment Asia Ltd, also known as Manulife Regent Funds Direct.
Manulife Regent was launched in October 1994 as a 50-50 joint venture between Manulife Financial and Regent Pacific.

"Regent has decided to focus its resources on increasing its institutional business in Asia, as well as in the rapidly growing Eastern European markets, particularly in Russia," Regent Pacific director Sophia Shaw said.
Manulife Financial focused on significant growth in the insurance and employee benefit market in Hong Kong, the statement said.
